register.description: This Register contains the IP revision code

bitfield.description: IP Revision

register.description: This Register allows control of various parameters of the Interconnect Interface

bitfield.description: Slave interface power management, Idle req/ack control

bitenum.description: Idle request is acknowledged based on the internal activity of the module
An idle request is never acknowledged
Idle request is acknowledged unconditionally

bitfield.description: Software reset Sets this bit to 1 to trigger a module reset. [[br]]The bit is automatically reset by the hardware. [[br]]During reads, it always returns 0

bitenum.description: The module is reset
Normal mode

bitfield.description: Internal clock gating strategy (interconnectL4 and display controller clock)

bitenum.description: Automatic clock gating strategy is applied for the interconnect L4 clock and display controller clock, based on the interconnect interface and internal activity
Interconnect L4 clock and display controller clock are free-running.

register.description: This register provides status information about the module, excluding the interrupt status information.

bitfield.description: Data are pending to be processed from interconnect FIFO.

bitenum.description: Data Pending
No Data Pending

bitfield.description: L4 Interface busy status bit

bitenum.description: The access to any of the following registers is stalled: RFBI_CMD, RFBI_DATA, RFBI_STATUS, RFBI_PARAM, RFBI_READ.
The access to the following register is not stalled: RFBI_CMD, RFBI_DATA, RFBI_STATUS, RFBI_PARAM, RFBI_READ

bitfield.description: Internal reset monitoring

bitenum.description: Reset Completed
Internal module reset is on-going

register.description: The control register allows configuration of the RFBI module

bitfield.description: Smart DMA request

bitenum.description: The dmareq is de-asserted after 2 clk cycles if it has been asserted for more than or equal to 2 clk cycles and MIdlereq is high in smart idle or no idle mode. No more burst requests will be given even if the space is available in the interconnect FIFO.
The dmareq is asserted and de-asserted depending on the interconnect FIFO space even if MIdlereq is high in smart idle/no-idle mode and the entire burst gets error responses from the module.

bitfield.description: Disable DMA request

bitenum.description: The dmareq is disabled and the signal is not generated at all based on space in the interconnect FIFO. It stays high until the DISABLE DMAREQ is high even if there is space in the interconnect FIFO to take requests.
The dmareq is enabled and the signal is generated based on the space available and the request coming into the data register.

bitfield.description: Defines the interconnect FIFO high threshold used by HW to assert DMA request. [[br]]Used only if data written to RFBI_DATA are sent using system DMA

bitenum.description: Size of the transfer of 16 words of 32-bit wide
Size of the transfer of 8 words of 32-bit wide
Size of the transfer of 4 words of 32-bit wide

bitfield.description: Internal Trigger

bitenum.description: User sets the ITE bit to start the transfer, when H/W takes into account the bit, the H/W resets it
H/W waits for ITE bit to be set if in internal trigger mode for the configuration in use

bitfield.description: Select the CS and configuration

bitenum.description: CS0 and CS1 both selected (only the configuration for CS0 isused)
CS1 selected and configuration #1
CS0 selected and Configuration #0
No CS selected

bitfield.description: Bypass Mode

bitenum.description: The bypass mode is selected
The bypass mode is not selected

bitfield.description: Enable/Disable flag

bitenum.description: Enable RFBI
Disable RFBI

register.description: The control register configures the RFBI pixel count value.

bitfield.description: Pixel counter value The S/W indicates the number of pixels to transfer to the LCD panel frame buffer. [[br]]The value is set when the module is disabled. [[br]]During the transfer the HW decrements the register when a pixel has been sent to the RFB.

register.description: The control register configures the number of lines to synchronize the beginning of the transfer.

bitfield.description: Programmable line number Line number from 0 to 2^[[br]]11-1. [[br]]Number of HSYNC after the VSYNC occurs before the beginning of the transfer.

register.description: The control register configures the RFBI command

bitfield.description: Command Value 8/9/12/16 bit value depending on the parallel mode

register.description: The control register configures the RFBI parameter.

bitfield.description: Param Value 8/9/12/16 bit value depending on the parallel mode

register.description: The control register configures the RFBI data.

bitfield.description: Data value 12/16/18/24/2x16 bit value depending on the Data type

register.description: The control register configures the RFBI read

bitfield.description: Read Value 8/9/12/16 bit value depending on the parallel mode

register.description: The control register configures the RFBI status.

bitfield.description: Status value 8/9/12/16 bit value depending on the parallel mode

register.description: The control register configures the RFBI VSYNC minimum pulse width

bitfield.description: Programmable min VSYNC pulse width Minimum VSYNC pulse width from 0 to 65535. [[br]]Number of L4 clock cycles to determine when VSYNC pulse occurs. [[br]]The values 0 and 1 are invalid.

register.description: The control register configures the RFBI HSYNC minimum pulse width.

bitfield.description: Programmable min HSYNC pulse width Minimum HSYNC pulse width from 0 to 65535. [[br]]Number of L4 clock cycles to determine when HSYNC pulse occurs. [[br]]The values 0 and 1 are invalid.
